dict.string: In your callback from `tj.listen(_:)`, be sure to check if the `response` corresponds to one of the prompts.

`VisionResponse` has a property named `objects` for all of the objects recognized by Watson. Each object has a `name` property describing what the object is, and a `confidence` property showing Watson's confidence that the object is present in the image.

In order to have TJBot speak about the objects he sees, create a string variable to hold the speech message. Next, iterate over the objects in `visionResponse.objects` and append the name to this variable. Finally, call `tj.speak(_:)` with your message to speak it aloud!
Not seeing the results you expect? Be sure to check the `error` property of the `VisionResponse`.
